A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: This film is visually stunning\, beautifully acted and genuinely entertaining\, but that is essentially the only redeeming qualities of it. The plot is lazy\, uninspiring and too convenient at times. Additionally\, some character motivations are really off-putting which leads to situations that could have been avoided\, but were not because well\, there would be no movie. The humor is the typical Disney/MCU formula\, which is often forced and takes you out of the moment. Lastly\, without spoilers\, there is no cohesion between this film and TFA. Rian Johnson disregards and crudely removes any ties to anything set up in TFA. Last Jedi is an enjoyable enough film\, but it has major problems that weighs it down\, thus making it a disappointing addition to the Star Wars universe.
